reviews.review_msg: Stephen Brown constructed the course: The videos were informative and provided the core points in the chapter and really explained quite well and enjoyable to listen and learn. The quizzes and exams I found the most challenging. My downfall in the course. A lot tougher than I hoped this class would be. But very interesting information!

Unbelievable guy. If you pay attention and really conceptualize the class, it is easy and is very interesting to everyday life. This isn't a kickback class, but it is also not super difficult. Take your time on assignments and start early. Stephen is a very fair and respected guy. Very positive experience being taught by him.

His marking scheme is super subjective and course material is overall irrelevant to the field. Sure he's a nice guy but his slides are poorly presented and the "textbook" is full of errors. Basically a course where you memorize lists that won't help you in the future.
good thing this senile man is retiring, marks way too hard, not fair at all, dissapear stephen

His book is poorly written. Typos, lack of knowledge of the millennial era, irrelevant information, and he paraphrases articles so poorly that I'd rather just read the article it self. Lectures are almost a joke. Goes over like 10 slides in 2.5 hours. Take out the stretches and one break,  we'd be gone in 2 hours max including in class activity.

Honestly, the most enjoyable class you'll take in BPK upper division. This class is hilarious and you also learn quite a bit.  Stephen Brown does an awesome job keeping the class engaged and is very fair with grades. Take it with him!

Class was taken with Anne-Kristine Arnold but Stephen Brown created the course and the weekly videos were of him. Very well-organized course. Enjoyed the readings (mandatory, but entertaining - written by him); the assignments were doable; the quizzes/exams were completely fair. Not a heavy workload at all! Took as a B-SCI and loved it.
He was ok. Except that the questions on tests were very tricky and unclear. At the final exam, the TA was crazily busy answering questions from students.

His class is quite easy and even though its 3hrs long, he usually ends it in one and a half hours. He doesn't teach much in class so you really need the textbook for the concept and because the questions are right from the textbook. He also takes stretch breaks every few minutes too so it's never really boring. It's the only class I never slept in.

I didn't specifically have him as my professor for this class online but everything on canvas was by him including short video lecture material. In the short 10-15 minutes of him lecturing, you can thoroughly tell that he is passionate and does not bore you! Found this class very interesting and was not bored when studying. Marking depends on TA

Outcome of taking 140 online completely depends on your TA. Stephen puts incredible amounts of effort into using Canvas to it's best extent, posting podcasts and modules. Weekly quizzes can bring down your mark. Do the study questions for the exams and use your TA! Passionate professor, interestinguseful class. Would take him again.

I've never been so frustrated with a professor. I took BPK 140 online and with 2 out of 3 assignments he changed the criteria several times as close as a few nights before it was due then sent out mass emails to students complaining we didn't do what he wanted. Also lots of reading (weekly quizzes) but at least it's an easy course overall.

Good prof to have for an online class. Weekly quizzes, 3 quizzes, 1 MT, 1 final all semester long. He explained his topic well in the book he wrote and the weekly videos. Exams were fair, took this as my elective. Solid class.

This guy never once posted anything throughout the entire semester and only showed up for the final. Final was cumulative and our TM told us anything was fair game. Read an entire textbook + a million online articles. I spent more work on this course than any of my 300 level writing intensive courses. What a joke. (online course)

Good way to get your science credit if your an arts student. For the exams, make good use of the quizzes as they will prepare you for the exams. Took this class and Arch 131 with Dennis Sandgathe for my science credit, liked Arch 131 more, but this class was not bad for a science credit as well.
Great prof; Fun and engaging! Must attend class to get a good mark though but he makes the three hour lectures fly by

He's got a different teaching style (lots of stretch breaks, etc).  He's always prepared for class.  He tries hard to be nice and tries to learn everyone's name.  Don't like his exams (though I don't like most KIN exams).  While the in-class stuff is easy, the exam marking is pretty inconsistant. There was a long line at office hours for the midter

He's a great prof who really wants his students to do well and is very open to suggestions. Wasn't all that interested in the material prior to the semester but loved his lectures and found classes to be fun. Enjoyed stretch breaks in class and the exams were very straight forward. Go to class, do the study questions and you'll do fine.

"MMM HMMMM" If you've taken 340 with Stephen you know what to expect. Good lectures and clear notes.  The exams, however, are a nightmare. He'll ask a very simple and straightforward question, but expect a long detailed answer. I'm still not sure what to think of him... If you have a choice, I'd say to choose another class.
A prof who shows genuine interest in helping students. Highly recommended if you want to learn and are interested in the course material. Not your type if you're lazy and don't show up to lecture.

I only took this class because I loved his teaching style from KIN304. Quizzes and continuing concepts keep you informed and up to date. If you want to learn, this guy makes it easy to ace his classes. Can't wait to take KIN382!

if you enjoy talking about feelings and writting in a journal, this is a course for you. I would rather chew glass for 3 hours than sit through another class with him. way 2 airy fairy. Exams are easy, material well explained. He drove me nuts. Teaching style is not for me. He nods holding his chin and saying mmmhuh alot. NEVER TAKE HIM AGAIN
